title: Understanding Schizophrenia
text: Schizophrenia is a complex mental disorder that affects how a person thinks, feels, and behaves. It is characterized by a range of symptoms, including delusions, hallucinations, and disorganized thinking.

title: Neurotransmitter Imbalance
text: One theory suggests that schizophrenia is linked to an imbalance of neurotransmitters in the brain, particularly dopamine, serotonin, and glutamate.

title: Genetic Factors
text: Genetic factors play a significant role in the development of schizophrenia. Individuals with a family history of the disorder are at a higher risk.

title: Environmental Influences
text: Environmental factors, such as prenatal exposure to infections or malnutrition, can increase the risk of developing schizophrenia.
